law.catch_line: Exclusion from coverage as operator by agreement.
law.text: In an automobile liability insurance policy, the insurer and the named insured may agree to exclude any member of the household not a spouse or dependent from coverage as the operator of an insured vehicle. The names of persons excluded shall be set forth in the policy or in an endorsement that is signed by both parties.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 101, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1990.
